A figure formed by two rays which start from a common point (a plane angle) or by three planes that intersect (a solid angle).
definitions.example: the angle between lines A and B

definitions.definition: The measure of such a figure. In the case of a plane angle, this is the ratio (or proportional to the ratio) of the arc length to the radius of a section of a circle cut by the two rays, centered at their common point. In the case of a solid angle, this is the ratio of the surface area to the square of the radius of the section of a sphere.
definitions.example: The angle between lines A and B is π/4 radians, or 45 degrees.

definitions.definition: A corner where two walls intersect.
definitions.example: an angle of a building

definitions.definition: A change in direction.
definitions.example: The horse took off at an angle.

definitions.definition: A viewpoint; a way of looking at something.
The focus of a news story.
Any of various hesperiid butterflies.
A storyline between two wrestlers, providing the background for and approach to a feud.
An ulterior motive; a scheme or means of benefitting from a situation, usually hidden, often immoral
definitions.example: His angle is that he gets a percentage, but mostly in trade.

definitions.definition: A projecting or sharp corner; an angular fragment.
Any of the four cardinal points of an astrological chart: the Ascendant, the Midheaven, the Descendant and the Imum Coeli.
(often in the passive) To place (something) at an angle.
definitions.example: The roof is angled at 15 degrees.

definitions.definition: To change direction rapidly.
definitions.example: The five ball angled off the nine ball but failed to reach the pocket.

definitions.definition: To present or argue something in a particular way or from a particular viewpoint.
definitions.example: How do you want to angle this when we talk to the client?

definitions.definition: (cue sports) To hamper (oneself or one's opponent) by leaving the cue ball in the jaws of a pocket such that the surround of the pocket (the "angle") blocks the path from cue ball to object ball.
A fishhook; tackle for catching fish, consisting of a line, hook, and bait, with or without a rod.
To try to catch fish with a hook and line.
(with for) To attempt to subtly persuade someone to offer a desired thing.
definitions.example: He must be angling for a pay rise.

definitions.definition: The act of appearing or coming into sight; the act of becoming visible to the eye.
definitions.example: His sudden appearance surprised me.

definitions.definition: A thing seen; a phenomenon; an apparition.
definitions.example: There was a strange appearance in the sky.

definitions.definition: The way something looks; personal presence
Apparent likeness; the way which something or someone appears to others.
definitions.example: Some people say I'm shallow because I care so much about my appearance.

definitions.definition: That which is not substance, essence, hypostasis; the outward reality as opposed to the underlying reality
definitions.example: Catholicism teaches that the Eucharist, while remaining under the physical appearance of bread and wine, becomes really and truly the body and the blood of Christ.

definitions.definition: The act of appearing in a particular place, or in society, a company, or any proceedings; a coming before the public in a particular character.
definitions.example: A person makes his appearance as an historian, an artist, or an orator.

definitions.definition: An instance of someone coming into a court of law to be part of a trial, either in person or represented by an attorney or such like; a court appearance
Chiefly used by nurses: the act of defecation by a patient.
definitions.example: The patient had a small bowel obstruction and there was no appearance until after the obstruction resolved.

definitions.definition: (feudal law) A right to the use of a superior's land, as a stipend for services to be performed; also, the land so held; a fief.
An inheritable estate in land held of a feudal lord on condition of the performing of certain services.
An estate of inheritance in land, either absolute and without limitation to any particular class of heirs (fee simple) or limited to a particular class of heirs (fee tail).
Property; owndom; estate.
Money paid or bestowed; payment; emolument.
A prize or reward. Only used in the set phrase "A finder's fee" in Modern English.
A monetary payment charged for professional services.
To reward for services performed, or to be performed; to recompense; to hire or keep in hire; hence, to bribe.
A group, set, or series of ten , particularly:
definitions.example: a decade of soldiers

definitions.definition: A set of resistors, capacitors, etc. connected so as to provide even increments between one and ten times a base electrical resistance.
The interval between any two quantities having a ratio of 10 to 1.
definitions.example: There are decades between 1.8 and 18, between 25 and 250 and between 0.03 and 0.003.

definitions.definition: To make happy or satisfy; to give pleasure to.
definitions.example: Her presentation pleased the executives.

definitions.definition: To desire; to will; to be pleased by.
definitions.example: Just do as you please.

definitions.definition: Happy, content
